title: Who delivers the disciples of ISKCON Gurus? | His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.text: The GBC of ISKCON Mumbai Group, in its Resolution No. 303, titled GBC Statement on the Position
of Srila Prabhupada, has stated that, Lord Krishna, the Supreme Personality of Godhead,
is the original Guru, whose divine grace descends through the medium of the Guru Parampara.
As such, a devotee is ultimately delivered by Sri Krishna, acting through a combination of
various manifestations of His mercy. These include, but are not limited to, the Chaitya Guru,
Srila Prabhupada, the Guru Parampara, one's Diksha Guru, other Siksha Gurus, the Holy Name,
Shastra and the nine processes of devotional service. So, according to this Resolution of
the GBC, who delivers an ISKCON devotee from material entanglement? This is the question
before us today. According to the GBC, it is Sri Krishna, acting through a combination
of various manifestations of His mercy, such as the Chaitya Guru, Srila Prabhupada, the Guru
Parampara, one's Diksha Guru, other Siksha Gurus, the Holy Name, Shastra, Navaveda Bhakti,
So, we will see, is this statement of the GBC of ISKCON Mumbai Group, backed by Srila
Prabhupada's teachings and Shastra? Continue listening to find out. In his purport to verse
8 of chapter 25 of the third canto of the Srimad Bhagavatam, Srila Prabhupada says,
This verse is very instructive, since it indicates the relationship between the spiritual master
and the disciple. The disciple or conditioned soul is put into this darkest region of ignorance
and therefore is entangled in the material existence of sense gratification. It is very
difficult to get out of this entanglement and attain freedom. But if one is fortunate enough
to get the association of a spiritual master, it is possible.
Like Kapila Muni or his representative, then by his grace, one can be delivered from the
mire of ignorance. The spiritual master is therefore worshipped as one who delivers the
disciple from the mire of ignorance with the light of the torch of knowledge.
The word Paragam is very significant. Paragam refers to one who can take the disciple to
the other side. This side is conditioned life. The other side is the life of freedom. The
spiritual master takes the disciple to the other side by opening his eyes with knowledge.
We are suffering simply because of ignorance. By the instruction of the spiritual master,
the darkness of ignorance is removed and thus the disciple is enabled to go to the side of
freedom. It is stated in Bhagavad Gita that after many, many births, one surrenders to
the Supreme Personality of Godhead. Similarly, if after many, many births, one surrenders
to the Supreme Personality of Godhead, one is able to find a bona fide spiritual master
and surrender to such a bona fide representative of Krishna, one can be taken to the side of
So, well, please note Shaila Prabhupada's opening statement of this purport that these
words indicate the relationship between the spiritual master and the disciple. These are
these words are specifically about the relationship between the Diksha Guru and his disciple.
Therefore, this purport which we have just now gone through is very relevant to our current
discussion. And in this purport, Shaila Prabhupada says no less than five times, yes, you heard
it right, five times that it is the Diksha Guru who delivers the disciple.
The first place, Shaila Prabhupada says, it is very difficult to get out of this entanglement
and attain freedom. But if one is fortunate enough to get the association of a spiritual
master like Kapilamani or his representative, then by his grace, whose grace, the spiritual
master's grace, one can be delivered from the mire of ignorance.
So, here clearly, Shaila Prabhupada says that the Diksha Guru is the one who delivers the
Then again, Shaila Prabhupada says a second time in the purport, the spiritual master
is therefore worshipped as one who delivers the disciple from the mire of ignorance with
the light of the torch of knowledge.
Again, Diksha Guru is worshipped as the one who delivers the disciple.
Then a third time, Shaila Prabhupada says, Paragam refers to one who can take the disciple
The other side is the life of freedom.
The spiritual master takes the disciple to the other side by opening his eyes with knowledge.
As if that were not enough, a fourth time, Shaila Prabhupada says, by the instruction
of the spiritual master, the darkness of ignorance is removed and thus the disciple is enabled
to go to the side of freedom.
So, it is the instruction of the Diksha Guru that removes the darkness of ignorance.
That removes the darkness of ignorance of the disciple, enabling him to achieve freedom.
Then, a fifth time, Shaila Prabhupada says in this very purport, it is stated in Bhagavad
Gita that after many, many births, one surrenders to the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
Similarly, if after many, many births, one is able to find a bona fide spiritual master
and surrender to the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
If one is able to surrender to such a bona fide representative of Krishna, one can be
taken to the side of light.
Only if one gets a bona fide Diksha Guru, can one be taken to the side of light.
Let me remind you that Shaila Prabhupada began this purport, how?
By saying that this verse is very instructive about the spiritual master and his disciple.
Hence, we have to understand that wherever in this purport, Shaila Prabhupada is taking
into account the spiritual master, it must refer to Diksha Guru because that is the specific
subject of discussion in the verse and the purport.
So, very clearly from this purport, we can see that Shaila Prabhupada taught that it
is the Diksha Guru who delivers the disciple, not the Siksha Guru or anyone else.
So, then the question may arise, what is the role of the holy name and all the other items
mentioned as the combined deliverers in the GBC resolution like the holy name, the Siksha
Well, Shaila Prabhupada says this in the purport to the 61st verse of chapter 9 of Madhya Leela
It is the spiritual master who delivers the disciple from the clutches of Maya by initiating
him into the chanting of the Hare Krishna Maha Mantra.
So, we can understand that the deliverer is one.
To deliver the disciple, the Diksha Guru initiates him into chanting the holy name, performing
Navaveda Bhakti, worshipping the Deity, etc.
Yes, all these are essential in the deliverance of a conditioned soul.
But if we ask, who delivers the devotee?
The answer is not that it is Krishna through a combination of Diksha Guru, Siksha Guru,
as erroneously resolved by the GBC of ISKCON Mumbai group.
On the other hand, the responsibility of delivering the disciple is taken by the Diksha Guru,
We have to understand that everyone's responsibility is nobody's responsibility.
The holy name may be there.
But one person has to take the responsibility of delivering the disciple.
It cannot be left to some vague combination of everyone together delivering the devotee.
That one person who takes the entire responsibility of delivering the disciple is the Diksha Guru.
For delivering the disciple, the Diksha Guru is empowered by Krishna to engage the disciple
in worshipping the holy name by chanting a prescribed number of rounds,
In other words, if one chants the holy name,
but doesn't have a Diksha Guru,
then none of them will take responsibility to deliver the devotee.
Only when the devotee surrenders unto a bona fide Diksha Guru,
will the Diksha Guru take responsibility to deliver the disciple.
In the Srimad Bhagavatam, canto 4, chapter 24, verses 31 and 32 purport,
When a mantra is chanted by a great devotee, the mantra becomes more powerful.
Although the Hare Krishna Mahamantra is powerful in itself,
receives the mantra from his spiritual master.
For, when the mantra is chanted by the spiritual master,
So, it is clear that the holy name,
are all acting to deliver the devotee.
But, without the grace of a bona fide Diksha Guru,
it is impossible to be delivered.
if a devotee doesn't have a bona fide Diksha Guru,
but is chanting the holy name,
then, the Paramatma will guide the devotee to a bona fide Diksha Guru,
and then, that bona fide Diksha Guru will take the disciple back to Krishna,
delivering him from the material entanglement.
On the other hand, if one has everything,
but has no bona fide Diksha Guru,
in his purport to the verses 8 through 12
of the 13th chapter of the Bhagavad Gita,
because a bona fide spiritual master
if he bestows any blessings upon his disciple,
that will make the disciple immediately advanced
without the disciples following the regulated principles.
the regulated principles will be easier
for one who has served the spiritual master without reservation.
If the Diksha Guru bestows his blessings upon his disciple,
then, the disciple becomes immediately advanced
without following any of the regulated principles
chanting prescribed number of rounds, etc.
That is the power of the bona fide Diksha Guru.
And where does the Diksha Guru get such power?
who has directly empowered the Diksha Guru like that.
the GBC of ISKCON Mumbai group
has diluted the power of the Diksha Guru
it is not the Diksha Guru who delivers the disciple.
through many many manifestations of His mercy.
acting through a combination of various manifestations of His mercy.

This is a whole new spin
